reasons_to_visit.details: September offers ideal temperatures (13-21°C) with comfortable days and cool evenings perfect for exploring Hradec Kralove's historic center and university campus.
Early fall foliage starts appearing in parks, university campus, and along the Elbe and Orlice rivers, creating beautiful scenery for photography and walks.
The university city comes alive with returning students, academic events, and vibrant campus life creating an energetic atmosphere throughout the city.
Tourist numbers decrease significantly while weather remains excellent, making it ideal for exploring the White Tower, Cathedral of the Holy Spirit, and other landmarks.
September marks the return of serious cultural programming with university performances, theater events, and cultural festivals throughout the city.
Perfect weather for enjoying the confluence of the Elbe and Orlice rivers, with riverside cafes, walking paths, and comfortable outdoor activities.
Long daylight hours (12-13 hours) provide excellent conditions for photographing the city's unique blend of Gothic and modern architecture.

reasons_to_avoid.details: Daylight hours begin decreasing (12-13 hours), affecting late evening activity timing and photography opportunities.
September can bring more frequent rain showers requiring weather preparation and flexible outdoor activity plans.
Early September coincides with university orientation and registration periods, which can create busy conditions in certain areas.
Temperature fluctuations between warm days and cool evenings require layered clothing and can affect outdoor sightseeing plans.
